type(IAny2EVMMessageReceiver).interfaceId || interfaceId == type(IERC165).interfaceId This allows CCIP to check if ccipReceive is available before calling it. If this returns false or reverts, only tokens are transferred to the receiver. If this returns true, tokens are transferred and ccipReceive is called atomically. Additionally, if the receiver address does not have code associated with it at the time of execution (EXTCODESIZE returns 0), only tokens will be transferred.","params":{"interfaceId":"The interfaceId to check"},"returns":{"_0":"true if the interfaceId is supported"}},"updateBridgeFee(uint256)":{"params":{"newFee":"New bridge fee in ETH"}},"updateTransferLimits(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"newMaxAmount":"New maximum transfer amount","newMinAmount":"New minimum transfer amount"}}},"title":"PropertyBridge","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"acceptOwnership()":{"notice":"Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient."},"bridgePropertyTokens(uint64,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Bridge property tokens to another chain"},"ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,(address,uint256)[]))":{"notice":"Called by the Router to deliver a message. params.amount: The amount of tokens to bridge
params.receiver: The receiver address on destination chain

ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,.details: Note ensure you check the msg.sender is the OffRampRouter

params.propertyBridge: The PropertyBridge contract address on destination chain
params.propertyToken: The PropertyToken contract address on destination chain

returns.totalBalance: The total balance across all chains

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Should indicate whether the contract implements IAny2EVMMessageReceiver e.g. return interfaceId == type(IAny2EVMMessageReceiver).interfaceId || interfaceId == type(IERC165).interfaceId This allows CCIP to check if ccipReceive is available before calling it. If this returns false or reverts, only tokens are transferred to the receiver. If this returns true, tokens are transferred and ccipReceive is called atomically. Additionally, if the receiver address does not have code associated with it at the time of execution (EXTCODESIZE returns 0), only tokens will be transferred.

returns._0: true if the interfaceId is supported

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

bridgePropertyTokens(uint64,address,addr.notice: Bridge property tokens to another chain

ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,.notice: Called by the Router to deliver a message. If this reverts, any token transfers also revert. The message will move to a FAILED state and become available for manual execution.

configureChain(uint64,address,address,ui.notice: Configure a destination chain for property token bridging

getLastReceivedMessageDetails().notice: Get the last received message details

getUserTotalBalance(address).notice: Get user's total balance across all chains

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.
